title.narrative: Integration GALS in orange value chain

participating-org.narrative:
The Center for Promoting Development for Women and Children (DWC) is a Vietnamese non-profit, non-governmental organization established in 2003 under the Decision No. 232 of Vietnam Association for Promoting Education (VAPE). VAPE recognized officially as a social association by Vietnamese Government.
DWC mission is to improve the quality of life for disadvantaged people, especially Women and Children through research, education and training, and to facilitate sustainable development projects and programs, contributing to the National Poverty Reduction Program, and Gender Equality. DWC envisions a Vietnam without poverty where women and children enjoy equal rights and participate in all relevant process of political, economic, cultural and social life.
Trung tam Ho tro PT vi Phu nu va Tr (DWC)

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood

description.narrative: Shifted norms & attitudes: # of citizens (M/F), incl.people living in poverty, consider gender equality in workers employment policies and a more gender equal division of labour and income (including unpaid care work), a vital right and good practice.
role models / frontrunners expressing their views during events / on platforms organized by Oxfam and partners

Shifted norms & attitudes: # of citizens (M/F), incl.people living in poverty, consider gender equality in workers employment policies and a more gender equal division of labour and income (including unpaid care work), a vital right and good practice.

men, incl.people living in poverty, consider gender equality in workers employment policies and a more gender equal division of labour and income (including unpaid care work), a vital right and good practice.
